page.title: 03FAIR EVENTS
page.content: and lavender bags. All the things should be hand made. There is a ducking pond in the Market Place. In the olden days the ducking pond was used for punishing women who nagged and scolded their husbands. But today we duck people for fun. For example people who do not wear fair costume when they are serving on a stall, get ducked. There are also stocks built of wood. The organisers of the Fair put people in the stocks. The people standing around throw wet sponges at them. In the middle of the Market Place a wooden stage is erected so that children and adults can entertain the crowds. A band comes from Norway and plays brass instruments on the stage. Many people come for a holiday to Alnwick during the fair and they enjoy watching the dancing.
